intro: Bdallophytum oxylepis, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. Bdallophytum oxylepis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
